                                                                                                                          when we get home again.
                                                                                                                              And now our last walk is ended ; to-morrow we
                                                                                                                          return to Preston; the refreshing sea-air has put
                                                                                                                          strength into our limbs and pure blood into our veins.
                                                                                                                          I hope you will all continue to use your eyes in the
                                                                                                                          examination   of those countless forms of plants and
Public Domain, Google-digitized / http://www.hathitrust.org/access_use#pd-google
                                                                                                                          animals which surround us on all sides, whether in the
                                                                                                                          country or at the sea-side. It has been well said that
                                                                                                                          " mere amusement will naturally lead us into the
                                                                                                                          solemn temples of philosophy," for the naturalist may
                                                                                                                          be anything, everything.     " He   may yield to the charm
                                                                                                                                                                           11

                                                                                                                          154        Sea-side   Walks of a Naturalist.
                                                                                                                          of simple observation ; he may study the habits and
                                                                                                                          habitats of animals, and moralise on their ways ; he
                                                                                                                          may use them as starting points of laborious research ;
                                                                                                                          he may carry his newly-observed facts into the highest
                                                                                                                          region of speculation ; and whether roaming amid the
                                                                                                                          lovely nooks of nature in quest of varied specimens,
                                                                                                                          or fleeting the quiet hour in observation of his pets —
                                                                                                                          whether he make natural history an amusement, or
                                                                                                                          both amusement and serious work — it will always offer
                                                                                                                          him exquisite delight." We will take one more look at
                                                                                                                          the sea.
Generated for acobblah (University of Michigan) on 2015-11-02 14:49 GMT / http://hdl.handle.net/2027/mdp.39015067848567
                                                                                                                                      Beautiful, sublime, and glorious   ;
                                                                                                                                        Mild, majestic, foaming free    ;—
                                                                                                                                      Over time itself victorious,
                                                                                                                                        Image of eternity.
                                                                                                                                      Such art thou, stupendous ocean        !
                                                                                                                                        But, if overwhelmed by thee,
                                                                                                                                      Can we think without emotion
                                                                                                                                        What must thy Creator    be ?
